title: Will LoL ever implement replays in the client?
body: With this new match history with all new features such as gold lead and stuff, would it be possible if we could get replays as well? Thanks <3

replies.body:
Consider how buggy as fuck things like LoL replay are, especially to the point where they were breaking every patch.

Now consider the fact that Rito would probably have to keep way too many replays with a feature like this.

Now consider if it's worth Rito's money.
It would be nice if we can have a replay for the games but i don't think there is a need for it because there are things like lolreplay and op.gg out there.
lolreplay is buggy garbage, there is a massive need for lol replay
Fyi you can record with op.gg even with a mac. Im not sure if you can watch the replay on mac tho because the replay will be in .bat format and im not sure if mac can support that .bat format.
Yes you can use terminal but op.gg saves my files as .cmd so yeah

Normally no, but you can use the Spectator LoL app to work around this.
Needs a bit of Terminal work, however. bat files are windows system files (no idea why they decided to use that), so it's a bit tricky.

Note how Boards limits the format of files you can attach.
Note how these files can only be *.JPG*, *.JPEG*, *.PNG* (pictures and images), *.TXT*  (text), *.R3D* (video), *.LOG* (logs)... and **.ROFL.**
.ROFL is the native replay format for League of Legends, currently still in development. I have a couple such files from a testing session on PBE.

Does that question your answer?
